name: Honey-Sriracha Air Fryer Wings
author: France C
summary: The perfect combination of spicy and sweet in every bite, with the ease of using an air fryer. Add more sriracha to suit your tastes. I like to serve the extra sauce on the side for dipping.
directions: Preheat an air fryer to 360 degrees F (182 degrees C)
Place chicken wings in a bowl and sprinkle with salt and garlic powder, tossing to coat
Place wings in the air fryer basket
Set timer for 25 minutes and cook wings, shaking basket every 7 to 8 minutes
When timer ends, turn air fryer off and let wings stand in the basket for 5 minutes more
Meanwhile, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat
Whisk honey, rice vinegar, and sriracha sauce into butter and bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer sauce over medium-low heat for 8 to 10 minutes, whisking occasionally
Turn off heat and set aside; sauce will thicken as it cools
Toss cooked wings and sauce together in a bowl
Reserve extra sauce to serve alongside wings
